Build identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1

When the user presses alt to show the menu items (File, Edit, View, etc), opening a new tab does not work as expected. In contrary, if the menu items are visible and the user clicks on another tab, they are redirected to that tab. If they have the menu items visible, they are able to close a tab. It seems odd that they can close a tab or navigate to another tab with the menu items showing but they cannot open a new tab.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch Firefox
2. Make sure you do not have the Firefox orange button disabled and that you cannot see the menu items (File, Edit, View, etc).
3. Press ALT - Menu items should now show at the top
4. Try to open a new tab by clicking on '+'

Expected Results:
A new tab is opened and the menu items are hidden again

Actual Results:
Menu items are hidden again but a new tab is not opened.
comments.creator: mdabbagh.mozilla@gmail.com
